alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 01 at 2:59PM AKST until March 02 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. West winds gusting to 60 mph around Whittier. Reduced visibility as low as one quarter mile. * WHERE...Whittier. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds are causing Blizzard conditions in and near Whittier with whiteout conditions being observed. Otherwise the rest of the area may see some brief periods of blowing snow but visibility should remain above a half mile.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
